content.title: Biotechnology Career Advancement And Re-orientation (BioCARe) Programme For Women Scientists
content.details: Biotechnology Career Advancement and Re-orientation (BioCARe) Programme, a special scheme of the Department of Biotechnology (DBT), Ministry of Science & Technology, the government of India aims to enhance the participation of women scientists in India towards research in Biotechnology and allied area. The program is mainly for the career development of unemployed female scientists for whom it will be the first “sanctioned” extramural research funding. Through this endeavor of the Department, a concerted effort would be made to give women scientists a strong foothold into the scientific profession, to help them re-enter the mainstream, and to provide a launch pad for further forays into the field of science and technology.
benefits: Research Grant up to ₹ 60,00,000 for Ph.D. holders
Research Grant up to ₹ 40,00,000 for M.Tech holders
Consolidated Fellowship of ₹ 68,000/month for Ph.D. holders
Consolidated Fellowship of ₹ 50,000/month for M.Tech holders
eligibility: Women scientists should be up to/below 55 years of age as of the last date of application submission.
Candidates in regular or permanent employment are not eligible.
Candidates who have already received any extramural funding as Principal Investigator are not eligible.
Women scientists working in temporary positions may apply but must leave their earlier assignment if approved.
Candidates registered in Ph.D. and receiving fellowships are not eligible.
exclusions: Candidates who are registered in Ph.D. and receiving any fellowships are not eligible to apply.
content.application_process: Online application through the link created on the PMU and Department of Biotechnology website.
documents_required: Proof of all Educational Qualifications (Degree Certificate, and Marksheets)
Proof of passing any National level examinations (if applicable)
Information regarding Achievements of the Applicant

faqs.question: What Is The Full Name Of The 'BioCARe' Scheme?
faqs.answer: The full name of 'BioCARe' Scheme is 'Biotechnology Career Advancement and Re-orientation'.

faqs.question: Who Is The Implementing Agency?
faqs.answer: On the behalf of Department of Biotechnology, this program is being managed by the Processing and Management Unit (PMU) established at International Centre for Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology (ICGEB), New Delhi.

faqs.question: What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Through this endeavor of the Department, a concerted effort would be made to give women scientists a strong foothold into the scientific profession, to help them re-enter the mainstream, and to provide a launch pad for further forays into the field of science and technology.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Duration Of The Project?
faqs.answer: The duration of the project is of three (3) years and is specified in the sanction order.

faqs.question: Which Research Areas Are Eligible For Financial Support?
faqs.answer: Eligible Areas for Financial Support include Animal and Marine Biotechnology, Bioengineering and Biomaterials, Medical Biotechnology, Environmental Biotechnology and Bioenergy, and Plant and Agriculture Biotechnology.
